}} 'Abdullah GÃ¼l' ( ; born 29 October 1950) is the 11th and current President of
Turkey, serving in that office since 28 August 2007. He previously served for
four months as Prime Minister from 2002 to 2003, and as Minister of Foreign
Affairs from 2003 to 2007.

Prime Minister Recep Tayyip ErdoÄan's nomination of GÃ¼l as a presidential
candidate drew strong and highly vocal opposition from ardent supporters of
secularism in Turkey. In May 2007, GÃ¼l's first bid for presidency was blocked by
the Constitutional Court, Ercan Yavuz (31 July 2008) [http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-
web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=148988 "Evidence indicates Ergenekon tried to
block presidential election"] Zaman. Retrieved on 9 February 2009. due to
concern over views GÃ¼l expressed during his Welfare Party years.
However, following the parliamentary elections in July of the same year, which
were won by the Justice and Development Party with 46.6% of the popular vote, he
was eventually elected President on 28 August 2007 and was sworn in the same
day, becoming the first president of Islamist background in the modern history
of Turkey. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/6966216.stm Turks elect
ex-Islamist president] BBC News (28 August 2007). Retrieved on 9 February 2009. [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-478468/Gul-sworn-
Turkeys-Islamist-president.html Gul sworn in as Turkey's first former Islamist
president] Daily Mail (29 August 2007). Retrieved on 9 February 2009.
